name: 2-(trifluoromethyl)benzonitrile
Reason: 2-(trifluoromethyl)benzonitrile is a derivative of benzonitrile, which has a melting point of -13°C. The trifluoromethyl group (CF3) is a polar and electron-withdrawing group, which can increase the melting point due to the following factors: (1) The polar nature of the CF3 group can increase the dipole moment of the molecule, which can enhance intermolecular forces and raise the melting point by approximately +10°C; (2) The electron-withdrawing effect of the CF3 group can increase the acidity of the nitrile group, which can lead to stronger hydrogen bonding and further increase the melting point by approximately +10°C. Summing up these changes: Benzonitrile base (-13°C), polar CF3 group (+10°C), and electron-withdrawing CF3 group (+10°C).
